    ASTAR - Lightweight A* pathfinding algoritm implementation in Java
    Author:
    Petterroea

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPath(boolean[] map, int w, int h, java.awt.Point start, java.awt.Point end)
      Gives you a path from start to end based on a map, where only straight paths are allowed(No diagnoal) Please note that it only takes a 1-dimensional array, because that is more proffesional.
      static java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPathWithDiagnoal(boolean[] map, int w, int h, java.awt.Point start, java.awt.Point end)
      Gives you a path from start to end based on a map, where diagnoal paths are allowed.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        public static java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPath(boolean[] map,
                                     int w,
                                     int h,
                                     java.awt.Point start,
                                     java.awt.Point end)
        Gives you a path from start to end based on a map, where only straight paths are allowed(No diagnoal) Please note that it only takes a 1-dimensional array, because that is more proffesional. Google converting a 2dimensional array to a 1dimensional array in java ;).
        Parameters:
        map - An array of booleans. False is air, true is wall
        w - Width of map
        h - Height of map
        start - The start point
        end - The end point
        Returns:
        A list containing all points in the best path. If no path is found, the list will be empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the points are outside the area

      • getPathWithDiagnoal

        public static java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getPathWithDiagnoal(boolean[] map,
                                                 int w,
                                                 int h,
                                                 java.awt.Point start,
                                                 java.awt.Point end)
        Gives you a path from start to end based on a map, where diagnoal paths are allowed. Please note that it only takes a 1-dimensional array, because that is more proffesional. Google converting a 2dimensional array to a 1dimensional array in java ;).
        Parameters:
        map - An array of booleans. False is air, true is wall
        w - Width of map
        h - Height of map
        start - The start point
        end - The end point
        Returns:
        A list containing all points in the best path. If no path is found, the list will be empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the points are outside the area
